alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 23 at 11:47PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...At Least Patchy Dense Fog Likely Overnight Into Tuesday Morning... Overnight and into the daylight hours Tuesday morning, at least patchy dense fog will likely develop across various portions of south central Nebraska and north central Kansas. Wherever fog becomes dense, visibility could drop to 1/4 mile or less, but with visibility likely varying considerably over short distances. Those traveling overnight should be prepared to encounter possible dense fog, and be on the lookout for possible slick spots due to fog freezing onto roadways and bridges. At this time, it is somewhat unclear whether dense fog will continue occurring on more of a localized, patchy and transient basis, or perhaps become more widespread and persistent. If fog eventually becomes more persistent and impacts a larger expanse of the area, the issuance of a formal Dense Fog Advisory will be considered.

area.areaDesc: Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith
